Package mru.game.controller

Class BlackjackGame

java.lang.Object
mru.game.controller.BlackjackGame
public class BlackjackGame extends Object
This class represents the logic for the blackjack game

  • Constructor Details

    • BlackjackGame

      public BlackjackGame(Player player)
      Creates a nee blackjack game and initializes the nessary game components to play the game
      Parameters:
      player - the player object who is playing the game

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This method starts the game and loops until the player wants to stop

    • initializeRound

      private void initializeRound()
      Prepares a new round of Blackjack. This method Resets everything for a new game. Clears both hands(Player and Dealer) Reshuffles the deck when it becomes low.

    • dealInitialCards

      private void dealInitialCards()
      Deals initial two cards to both player and dealer Dealer gets one face up and one face down Player gets both face up

    • promptBet

      private int promptBet(Scanner input)
      Prompts the player to enter a betting amount before each round. Makes sure that the player's inputs follow all betting rules
      Parameters:
      input - the Scanner used to get user input from the console.
      Returns:
      The validated bet amount as an integer.

    • askToKeepGoing

      private boolean askToKeepGoing(Scanner input)
      Asks the player if they would like to keep playing another round. The player's input is taken and converted to lowercase and trimmed of spaces. If player enters 'y', the game will continue any other input will end the game loop.
      Parameters:
      input - the Scanner object used to get the player's input.
      Returns:
      true if the player chooses to continue, false otherwise.

    • checkPlayerBalance

      private void checkPlayerBalance()
      Checks if the player's balance is enough to play another round. Method: Makes sure the player's balance is not below minimum bet amount. It calls different display messages through the gameplayMenu depending on whether the player has enough money or not.

    • playerTurn

      private void playerTurn(Scanner input)
      Runs the player's actions phase for the current round. While acting, the dealers hole card remains hidden. After each action, the current table is displayed. If the player busts, the turn ends right away. If the player stands, the dealer's hole is revealed and then the dealer plays.
      Parameters:
      input - shared Scanner for user input (Stand/Hit).

    • tableDisplay

      private void tableDisplay(List<Card> playerHandList, List<Card> dealerHandList)
      This method creates a table by calling print statements from the gameplayMenu class by using loop to print each row. The method also hides the second card of the dealer until the game ends or the player chooses to stand (dealers turn)
      Parameters:
      playerHandList - a list of card objects the player has
      dealerHandList - a list of card objects the dealer has

    • playerHitStandChoice

      private boolean playerHitStandChoice()
      Asks the player to choose between "Hit" or "Stand". This method will keep asking for input until they enter a valid option. Player can: Hit- draw another card from the deck. Stand - end their turn and allow the dealer to play.
      Returns:
      true if the player chooses to hit(draw cards), false if the player chooses to stand(end their turn).

    • dealerTurn

      private void dealerTurn()
      Controls the dealers turn. The dealer must always draw a card until their hand value is at least 17. If the dealer's total hand value goes over 21, they bust which means they lose automatically. Rules: Dealer shows their card before starting their turn. Dealer has to hit while total is 16 or less. Dealer has to stand once total is 17 or higher (including soft 17) If the dealer goes over 21 total hand value, it's a bust and the player wins the round.

    • calculateHandValue

      private int calculateHandValue(List<Card> list)
      This method calculates the total value of a hand first loop: adds up the total of all the cards in the hand and keeps track of the aces (does not add it yet) Second loop: if there are aces, and if the total value of the hand is more than 21 if the ace is worth 11, then the ace will be worth 1 if its less than 21 if the ace is worth 11, then the ace will be worth 11
      Parameters:
      list - this is the list that contains the several cards the dealer or the player has
      Returns:
      Returns the total value of the hand as an int

    • isBlackJack

      private boolean isBlackJack(List<Card> handList)
      Checks if the given hand is a natural blackjack. A natural blackjack happens when the first two cards dealt total to exactly 21.
      Parameters:
      handList - a list of Card objects representing either the player's or dealer's hand.
      Returns:
      true if the hand has exactly two cards and their total value equals 21, false otherwise.

    • isBust

      private boolean isBust(List<Card> handList)
      This method checks if the total hand is above 21 If the total hand is above 21, then that is considered a bust
      Parameters:
      handVal - the total value of a hand (calculated using .calculateHandValue() method
      Returns:
      true if total hand is above 21, False if less

    • determineWinner

      private String determineWinner()
      This method determines the results of the game when it ends
      Returns:
      the result f=of the match as a string

    • payout

      private void payout(String result)
      This method calculates and sets the final balance of the player
      Parameters:
      result - the result of the match, whether its a blackjack for the player, a tie, or just a regular win
